para.text: A contract indicating that an object is intended to understand a particular set of messages. As such, a protocol effectively determines the "type" (or "types") of an object. In Smalltalk, the compiler does not attempt to perform static type-checking as it compiles. This is a deliberate stance and is a fundamental part of the flexibility of the language. In Dolphin Smalltalk, you do have however, the ability to define advisory protocols and to indicate which classes conform to them.
